subject: Re: [junit] JUnit not matching to my needs - execute order shows design flaw ?
msgSnippet: Use composition as opposed to inheritance. public void testSpecific() { testCommon(); testSpecificAssumingCommonIsCalled(); }
messageBody:
Use composition as opposed to inheritance.

public void testSpecific()
{
testCommon();
testSpecificAssumingCommonIsCalled();
}



On Tue, 06 Jul 2004 08:09:23 -0000, hedgi <hedgi@...> wrote:
> Hi guys,
> Thanks for reading this.
> I experience the following problem
> with JUnit. My Company developes a
> Web Service that receives XML queries.
> Some of the queries are very similar.
> There are lots of 'health' objects on the server.
> And more than 10 commands "getlist" which
> return XML containing list of these objects.
> e.g. "glucose_getlist", "bloodpresure_getlist",
> "bloodsugar_getlist" etc.
> There are also filters for these "getlist" queries
> - "newerthan", "last", "device_manifacture" etc.
>
> I wanted to simplify testing these commands, so
> I made one "BasicGetListTest" which receives the
> name of the object and test for the common
> functionality - send a common request and receives
> all available objects with this name on the server .
> I want to use the result from this common test in
> the other methods with the filters to understand if
> "getlist" with filter returns all/less/more objects.
>
> Now I there is the problem. I want to run "testCommon"
> first which is in the "BasicGetListTest" but when I
> subclass it with "GlucoseGetListTest" it is always
> executed last. I read some of the postings in this
> newsgroup, but it seems that such kind of requirement
> point a desing flaw and I should somehow rearrange my
> Unit Test Structure to made the tests indepentdant. I'm
> stuck with it. On one hand I want to use inheritance to
> save code, on the other hand I cannot.
> I do not want to use TestSuit also, because this way I
> will have to write like 15-20 different similar TestSuits
> (one for each action with only a couple of characters
> different in the java code).
>
> Do you ,guys, have any fresh ideas how to do this ?
>
> have a nice day and thanks a lot,
> Kaloyan
>
